timeline.bodyText: Maybe something like array_position does not support elements of complex types that contain null? In theory T can be a map or a row.
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: nit: This check rather looks like an assertion. No matter what arguments are passed to this function the equals function should never return null, as the null case is explicitly checked before. For such assertions usually verify is preferred. (same for others).
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: IntelliJ would give warning on if (result) about null pointer exception when using verify. It's slightly annoying to look at but that's fine I suppose.
replies.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: It is interesting why Intellij understands checkArgument but doesn't undestand verify =\
replies.author: arhimondr

timeline.message:
Minor refactor of array_position

* Remove redundant logic to check null on equal method invocation
* Clarify error message

Minor refactor of array_position

* Remove redundant logic to check null on equal method invocation
* Clarify error message
